comment.author: 25889317@N06
comment._content: Why does everyone have a matching hat?

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/25889317@N06] This is the cap Swedish students wear as graduated from high school. Same cap today as in 1928, but in those days the students had to pass a tough examination to acquire it. :)
/Anna B.

comment.author: 16356723@N05
comment._content: Check out the girl in gloves!

comment.author: 43610516@N05
comment._content: It all looks very formal, compared with modern archaeologists!  Diggers on 'Time Team', the famous UK Channel4 programme, were always very casually dressed.  Does anyone know what these people found, by any chance?

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/bushmonkey10443] Actually, these people were most likely archaeology students, visiting the excavations for educational purposes. (However, they are registered in our photo database as "archaeologists".) 

Another photo from the same place shows what they found: prehistoric boat graves from about 550-1000 AD. (The dead person was buried in a small wooden boat, with grave goods. At Tuna about ten graves in a field, excavated in 1895-96, 1928 and 1936.) In the upper left corner you may view a "proper" working archaeologist with tools:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/swedish_heritage_board/8168859886/]

/Anna B.
